## forEachWith() function

Like `Array.prototype.forEach`<!-- -->, but `callbackfn` called with both the element of `array` and `obj` and returns `obj`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function forEachWith<T, U>(array: readonly T[], obj: U, callbackfn: (x: T, obj: U) => void): U;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  array | readonly T\[\] | The target array |
|  obj | U | An arbitrary object |
|  callbackfn | (x: T, obj: U) =&gt; void | A function which will be called with each element in <code>array</code> and <code>obj</code> |

<b>Returns:</b>

U

`obj`

## Example


```typescript
Arubyray.forEachWith([1, 2, 3], { sum: 0 }, (x, r) => (r.sum += x)) // => { sum: 6 }

```
